verses.text: O come, let us sing unto the \sc Lord\sc*: Let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.
Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving, \add And\add* make a joyful noise unto him with psalms.
For the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* a great God, And a great King above all gods.
In his hand \add are\add* the deep places of the earth: The strength of the hills \add is\add* his also.
The sea \add is\add* his, and he made it: And his hands formed the dry \add land\add*.
O come, let us worship and bow down: Let us kneel before the \sc Lord\sc* our Maker.
For he \add is\add* our God; And we \add are\add* the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To day if ye will hear his voice,
Harden not your heart, as \add in\add* the provocation, \add And\add* as \add in\add* the day of temptation in the wilderness:
When your fathers tempted me, Proved me, and saw my work.
Forty years long was I grieved with \add this\add* generation, And said, It \add is\add* a people that do err in \add their\add* heart, And they have not known my ways:
\add Unto\add* whom I sware in my wrath That they should not enter into my rest.
